maml:description.maml:para: Enables the IEC device for the ultimate 64 resp. 1541 ultimate. Warning: This feature needs a suitable firmware on that device and is just for developers.
Enables the IEC device for the ultimate 64 resp. 1541 ultimate. Warning: This feature needs a suitable firmware on that device and is just for developers.

maml:description.maml:para: Create an installer from a restore.car object and optionally installs C64 OS
Create an installer from a restore.car object and optionally installs C64 OS
The path where to save the output. Must be an empty directory.
Enable or disable extensions in root, that is ".prg", ".seq".
Choose a filename convention: Raw - '.prg' and '.seq" files, sd2iec compatible Ultimate64 - prg' and '.seq" files, ultimate 64 compatible x00 - (default) creates x00 files
Enables installation of C64 OS that is extracting the "OS" directory
The path where to save the output. Must be an empty directory.
Enable or disable extensions in root, that is ".prg", ".seq".
Choose a filename convention: Raw - '.prg' and '.seq" files, sd2iec compatible Ultimate64 - prg' and '.seq" files, ultimate 64 compatible x00 - (default) creates x00 files
Enables installation of C64 OS that is extracting the "OS" directory

command:example.maml:title: ----------------------- Typical workflow -----------------------
command:example.dev:code: C:\PS> get-C64OSRestore restore.car | Merge-C64OSUpdate .\updates\1.01.update.car, .\updates\1.02.update.car, .\updates\1.03.update.car | Expand-C64OSInstaller d:\ -Install $true

dev:remarks.maml:para: On Mac or Linux, use '/' instead of '\' in paths.

maml:description.maml:para: Reads the file "restore.car" from a C64 OS installation into memory
This cmdlet raeds the file "restore.car" from a C64 OS installation into memory. Source can be a file or an object.
In order to read the restore.car from a file, use this parammeter with the actual path.
In order to read the restore.car from an object of type C64Car, use this parameter.
In order to read the restore.car from a file, use this parammeter with the actual path.
In order to read the restore.car from an object of type C64Car, use this parameter.
This object type represents a 'restore.car' as part of C64 OS.

maml:description.maml:para: Merge C64 OS Updates into restore.car

This Cmdlet merges C64 OS updates into an object representing C64 OS restore.car. It heurestically checks if the update can be applied. If that check fails, you can try to apply the update with the parameter '-force'
The patch to be applied as an object
The object containg restore.car to patch
Skip heuristic for checking if update can be applied
The patch to be applied as a file resp. files.
The object containg restore.car to patch
Skip heuristic for checking if update can be applied
The object containg restore.car to patch
The patch to be applied as an object
Skip heuristic for checking if update can be applied
The patch to be applied as a file resp. files.
An object representing restre.car of C64 OS
An object representing restre.car of C64 OS

dev:remarks.maml:para: On Mac or Linux, use '/' instead of '\' in paths.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new general car object
Creates a new general car object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------- Create a new car file --------------------
command:example.dev:code: $car = New-C64CarArchive -CarType install -Version 2 ` -Date (New-C64CarArchiveDate -Year 123 -Month 6 -Day 4 -Hour 8 -Minute 0) ` -NotesASCII "PWSH only: Upd C64OS 1.0->1.0P" Update-C64CarArchive -Car $car -Path / -Directory -FileType ([byte][char]'D') -FilenameASCII "d 1.0P <- 1.0" Update-C64CarArchive -Car $car -Path "/services/File Manager/init.o" -File -FileType ([byte][char]'P') -FileContent (Get-Content -Raw -AsByteStream 1.0p\init.o.PRG ) Update-C64CarArchive -Car $car -Path "/utilities/Installer" -File -FileType ([byte][char]'P') -FileContent (Get-Content -Raw -AsByteStream 1.0p\Installer.PRG ) Update-C64CarArchive -Car $car -Path "/settings/version.t" -File -FileType ([byte][char]'S') -FileContent (Get-Content -Raw -AsByteStream 1.0p\version.t.SEQ ) Export-C64Carfile -Car $car -Path 1.0p.update.car

dev:remarks.maml:para: On Mac or Linux, use '/' instead of '\' in paths.
